The term "medium to close-up" is ambiguous; it would be clearer to define it as a medium shot of the desk that frames a close-up of the hand's activity, as the blueprints fill the frame but the hand is the focus. The description of depth is inconsistent; while the hand and rolled paper are placed in the "foreground," the pencil is only given a 2D position ("middle-left"). To improve this, the caption should specify that the pencil also rests in the foreground on top of the middle-ground blueprints. The path of the hand's movement is described in simple terms ("moves to," "moves across"); a more dynamic description, such as "the hand lifts from the phone and moves diagonally toward the middle-left," would better capture the motion. Finally, the description of the final action, "making a mark," is too general; assuming the video shows a clear action, specifying it (e.g., "circling a number" or "drawing a straight line") would provide a more concrete visual without being speculative.
